text: Found in the metal ark beneath Xhotl, the Cube of Darkness is as alien as it is powerful. Viewed up close, this small black cube contains millions of tiny pin-pricks of blinking light, each circling a sphere of pure darkness. By implementing the correct pattern of thoughts, the cube may be opened for a fraction of a second, inexpleciably drawing the very Winds of Magic into its depths.

The Crown's whispered advice lured Azhag into an ambush whereupon he was slain by Arkhan the Black, greatest of Nagash's servants. With the Crown now in his possession, the Great Necromancer's return is imminent.

This holy relic still bears the image of the Bretonnian hero's body, imprinted with his blood when he was mortally wounded. The Cultists of Tzeentch now use this sacred blood of the slain hero in their profane rituals.

Ghal Maraz is the legendary hammer of Sigmar and one of the most potent magical artefacts in the entire world. This rune-encrusted weapon has been the symbol of the Emperor's office ever since the founding of the Empire.
This ancient artifact of the Old Ones was once wielded by the legendary Saurus Kroq-Gar, before his defeat at the hands of Kairos Fateweaver. It has been repurposed into a weapon of dread power.

Brought to the world by the Old Ones, this weapon shimmers with unnatural power. Legends carved on ancient stone claim the blade exists on every plane of reality simultaneously, and that its edge can sever a creature's soul. No earthly force can stop this deadly blade - it penetrates granite and steel as easily as it slices through flesh and bone.

This lance was crafted from the heart of the Major Oak, the largest tree in Bretonnia, which was shattered by lightning the moment Gilles was struck down. Its blackened wood is covered with tiny carvings depicting the twelve battles of Gilles and, despite being harder than stone and diamond sharp, it is lightweight and beautiful to behold.

Scourge is a lethal whip, thirsty for blood and wrapped in the bitter curses of many generations of Bray-Shamans.

This powerful heirloom was forged from the finest Bretonnian siverline. It catches the sun's rays and magnifies them, dazzling the foe as the wielder makes their death stroke. It is now stained with the golden blood of Bretonnia's Royarch.

In ages past, the worldroots linked Athel Loren not only with every forest upon the face of the world, but those further afield also. Much has changed since those days. Many pathways are now forever closed, and those that remain can be unsealed only through the use of this ancient Moonstone.
A hand mirror fashioned from flawless ice and bound within an intricate frame of frostwork. A gift from the Ice Queen to Azazel, so that he can gaze upon his beautiful form whenever he deems fit.
Blade of Corruption
This sword was left for 13 days in the dreaded Cauldron of a Thousand Poxes before it was presented to the Leechlord as a gesture of peace from Clan Pestilens.
Warp Scroll
This copied magical script outlines techniques from the great Liber Bubonicus. It has been written in warpstone ink on flayed hides of those unable to withstand the Great Horned Rat's gifts.
Yueyin's Diamond
This brilliant crystal shines with the light of the true moon itself. Its touch is anaethama to daemons, and even to stare upon it is to risk banishment back to the Realms of Chaos.
The Rock of Inevitability

Deep in the Realm of Chaos sits the Inevitable City. It is an ageless edifice that lies ever distant from those who seek to reach it, and shadows every step taken by those who wish to escape it. The city has been destroyed many times, but has always rebuilt itself - and always will so long as a single stone remains. Indeed, if but one worn brick from its walls is planted in the mortal realm, it is said that a new city will soon arise.
Witstealer Sword
Forged in the molten heat of desire and cooled in a vat of Slaanesh's own blood, the Witstealer Sword was presented to the Arch-tempter by the Dark Prince himself.
Sliverslash
It is said Prince Sigvald's ornate sword is forged from a sliver of Slaanesh's own blade. It moves like quicksilver, striking its foes down in a flurry of lightning-quick blows.

Superior Collar of Khorne

Valkia's hellsmiths have used the blood of the slain Ice Witches to create a uniquely superior Collar of Khorne. This rune-etched brass collar will protect the wearer from all but the most grevious of magical attacks.
